data.title: Lawyer of the week: Sir Edward Garnier
data.meta_description: Sir Edward Garnier, QC, of One Brick Court, acted for former Conservative treasurer Lord McAlpine: the High Court ruled that a tweet about him, following a BBC Newsnight programme, by Sally Bercow
data.text:
Sir Edward Garnier, QC, of One Brick Court, acted for former Conservative treasurer Lord McAlpine: the High Court ruled that a tweet about him, following a BBC Newsnight programme, by Sally Bercow, the wife of House of Commons Speaker, John Bercow, was libellous. Damages have been agreed.

What were the main challenges and possible implications? The legal principles to be applied to the tweet were neither in doubt nor at issue between the parties. The difficulty lay in applying them to the facts and persuading the judge that although the tweet might look harmless it most certainly was not. If this case reminds people that tweets can cause serious harm, so much the better.
